page.title: 15Halewood Triangle Park
page.content: The Halewood Triangle Country Park is owned and managed by Knowsley Borough Council. It is a key area of open countryside lying adjacent to the Merseyside conurbation. The former railway land supports a range of {wildlife}habitats including ponds, meadows, heaths and woodland, which offer an attractive setting for a variety of countryside activities. The 28 acre park occupies part of the site of a{railway}intersection between the former Cheshire Lines Railway (now disused) and the main Liverpool-Warrington-Manchester line. The Park exhibits a notable diversity of habitats ranging from open water to{grassland}with heath, through open and dense scrub to semi deciduous{woodland.}There are 5{ponds} in the park, the largest of which is in the southern area. P.SWEENEY.
